title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0040

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And we're bringing you another great elementary lesson today, one that takes place at the office.
segments.cn: 今天我们为你带来另一节很棒的初级课程，发生在办公室。

segments.en: Yes.
Today, we're going to teach you some great phrases so that you can ask people to help you.
segments.cn: 今天，我们将教你一些很好的短语，以便你可以请求他人帮助。

segments.en: Right.
And I think this dialogue is with a new person at the office.
segments.cn: 我认为这个对话是和办公室的新同事进行的。

segments.en: So when you're new, you always need to ask people for favors.
segments.cn: 所以当你是新来的时，总是需要向人请求帮助。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay.
So we're going to be asking for a favor.
segments.cn: 所以我们将请求一个帮助。

segments.en: So Marco, what exactly is a favor?
Something that a person does for you.
Like a small, helpful thing.
segments.cn: 就像一个小的、帮助性的事情。

segments.en: Yeah, a small, helpful thing.
segments.cn: 是的，一个小的、帮助性的事情。

segments.en: So, you know, like, can you pass me that pencil?
segments.cn: 比如，你能把那支铅笔递给我吗？

segments.en: Maybe that's even a favor.
Yeah.
Or maybe, can you pick me up on your way to work?
segments.cn: 或者，你能在上班路上接我吗？

segments.en: Yeah, that's a favor.
Or even lending money to your friend.
That's a favor.
Yeah.
So that's what we're going to be talking about, favors and how to ask for one.
segments.cn: 所以我们将讨论帮助以及如何请求帮助。

segments.en: Because you always have to do this at work.
segments.cn: 因为你在工作中总是需要这样做。

segments.en: At work with your friends, with your family.
segments.cn: 在工作中，和朋友，和家人。

segments.en: So let's listen to the dialogue and then we'll come back and explain all the vocabulary.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听听对话，然后我们会回来解释所有的词汇。

segments.en: Um, sorry to bother you.
Um, my name is Rachel.
I'm new here.
Can I ask you for a favor?
Hi Rachel, welcome on board.
I'm afraid I can't help you right now.
segments.cn: 我恐怕现在无法帮助你。

segments.en: I'm getting ready for a very important meeting.
segments.cn: 我正在准备一个非常重要的会议。

segments.en: Excuse me, but can I bother you for a second?
segments.cn: 对不起，我可以打扰你一下吗？

segments.en: You know what?
I'd love to help you, but I'm about to meet an important client.
segments.cn: 我很乐意帮助你，但我正要见一个重要客户。

segments.en: Do you want to ask Sean instead?
He sits right over there.
Sorry to interrupt you, Sean.
Could you do me a quick favor?
Actually, I'm working on a document that's due in a couple of minutes.
segments.cn: 实际上，我正在处理一份几分钟后到期的文件。

segments.en: I really can't talk right now.
Sorry about that.
Geez, I just want to know where the bathroom is.
segments.cn: 天哪，我只想知道洗手间在哪里。

segments.en: What's wrong with you people?
So a pretty busy office.
segments.cn: 这是一个相当忙碌的办公室。

segments.en: Pretty unhelpful colleagues.
segments.cn: 同事们相当不乐于助人。

segments.en: I know everyone's so busy they didn't help this poor girl.
segments.cn: 我知道每个人都很忙，他们没有帮助这个可怜的女孩。

segments.en: Yeah, I hope she found the bathroom.
segments.cn: 是的，我希望她找到了洗手间。

segments.en: Now let's take a look at the language from the dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看对话中的语言。

segments.en: So let's start with language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以让我们从语言要点开始。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
There's some great language in this dialogue, wasn't there?
segments.cn: 这个对话中有一些很好的语言，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, a lot of interesting phrases and words.
segments.cn: 是的，有很多有趣的短语和单词。

segments.en: The first one that I saw that was really interesting is on board.
segments.cn: 我看到的第一个非常有趣的短语是“欢迎加入”。

segments.en: On board.
Welcome on board.
Well, we've got some examples of how this phrase is used.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有一些这个短语使用的例子。

segments.en: So let's listen to them to help us understand the meaning.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听听它们，以帮助我们理解意思。

segments.en: Example one.
Welcome on board, Sarah.
If you have any questions, please feel free to ask me.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何问题，请随时问我。

segments.en: Example two.
We need to get our new office assistant on board as soon as possible.
segments.cn: 我们需要尽快让我们的新办公室助理加入。

segments.en: Example three.
We decided to bring Melissa on board to join the marketing team.
segments.cn: 我们决定让Melissa加入市场团队。

segments.en: So basically it means... Welcome to the company.
segments.cn: 所以基本上它的意思是... 欢迎来到公司。

segments.en: Welcome to the company.
Or... The team.
Yeah.
Welcome on board.
So on board is the same as to the company.
segments.cn: 所以“欢迎加入”与“欢迎来到公司”是一样的。

segments.en: I guess also when you get on a ship, they'll tell you welcome on board.
segments.cn: 我想当你上船时，他们也会告诉你“欢迎加入”。

segments.en: Yes, that's where it comes from.
Or an airplane.
Welcome on board.
Okay, let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看下一个单词。

segments.en: About to.
About to.
I'm about to.
I'm about to.
So this is a great phrase to explain that you're about to do something.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个很好的短语，用来解释你正要做某事。

segments.en: I'm going to do this thing really soon.
Okay, so for example you can say, I'm about to go out for lunch.
segments.cn: 好吧，例如你可以说，我正要出去吃午餐。

segments.en: Or I could say, hey Marco, let's go record a show.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说，嘿Marco，我们去录制一个节目。

segments.en: I'm about to go into a meeting.
Exactly, yeah.
About to.
Going to do something really soon.
Okay, the next word we have is instead.
segments.cn: 好的，下一个单词是“而是”。

segments.en: Instead.
Instead.
It means in the place of.
In the place of.
Yep.
So for example, if we're at dinner, I could say, I'll have the chicken instead of the fish.
segments.cn: 所以例如，如果我们在吃晚餐，我可以说，我要鸡肉而不是鱼。

segments.en: Right?
Or I can say, I wanted to buy a red sweater, but they didn't have one, so I bought a blue one instead.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说，我想买一件红色毛衣，但他们没有，所以我买了一件蓝色的。

segments.en: Okay, so in the place of.
Yep.
And our last word for language takeaway, interrupt.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个语言学习词是，打断。

segments.en: Interrupt.
Interrupt.
Interrupt.
So when somebody interrupts you, they come in and... They talk to you while you're doing something.
segments.cn: 所以当有人打断你时，他们会进来... 他们在你做某事时和你说话。

segments.en: Or maybe while you're speaking.
Or maybe you're busy and people come and... Bother you.
segments.cn: 或者也许你很忙，人们进来... 打扰你。

segments.en: Bother you.
Okay.
So interrupt.
Interrupt.
Okay, some great words here in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，我们对话中有一些很好的词。

segments.en: And now we can listen to it again.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以再听一遍。

segments.en: This time it's going to be a little bit slower.
And you'll be able to understand the language a little bit better.
Um, sorry to bother you.
Um, my name is Rachel.
I'm new here.
Can I ask you for a favor?
Hi, Rachel.
Welcome on board.
I'm afraid I can't help you right now.
segments.cn: 我恐怕现在无法帮助你。

segments.en: I'm getting ready for a very important meeting.
segments.cn: 我正在准备一个非常重要的会议。

segments.en: Excuse me, but can I bother you for a second?
segments.cn: 对不起，但我可以打扰你一下吗？

segments.en: You know what?
I'd love to help you, but I'm about to meet an important client.
segments.cn: 我很想帮助你，但我马上要见一个重要客户。

segments.en: Do you want to try Sean instead?
He sits right over there.
Sorry to interrupt you, Sean.
Could you do me a quick favor?
Actually, I'm working on a document that is due in a couple of minutes.
segments.cn: 其实，我正在处理一份几分钟后到期的文件。

segments.en: I really can't talk to you right now.
segments.cn: 我现在真的不能和你说话。

segments.en: Sorry about that.
Geez, I just want to know where the bathroom is.
segments.cn: 天哪，我只是想知道洗手间在哪里。

segments.en: What's wrong with you people?
Okay, so there are some great ways that you can ask someone for a favor, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以有一些很好的方式可以请别人帮忙，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, we want to show you some really useful phrases for asking for help.
segments.cn: 是的，我们想给你展示一些非常有用的请求帮助的短语。

segments.en: So let's start with putting it together.
segments.cn: 所以让我们开始组合起来。

segments.en: Putting it together.
Let's listen to some different ways of how you can ask someone for a favor.
segments.cn: 让我们听听你可以用来请别人帮忙的不同方式。

segments.en: Example one.
May I get you to do me a favor?
Can you carry this package in your suitcase for me?
segments.cn: 你能帮我把这个包放进你的行李箱吗？

segments.en: Example two.
Can I ask you a favor?
Can you just finish this report for me?
segments.cn: 你能帮我完成这份报告吗？

segments.en: Example three.
Will you do me a favor and pass me that file?
segments.cn: 你能帮我把那个文件递给我吗？

segments.en: Okay, so those were great examples of asking for a favor.
segments.cn: 好的，这些都是请求帮忙的好例子。

segments.en: In our dialogue, we heard, can I ask you a favor?
segments.cn: 在我们的对话中，我们听到，可以请你帮个忙吗？

segments.en: But we could also say, can I get you to do me a favor?
segments.cn: 但我们也可以说，我可以请你帮个忙吗？

segments.en: Right, can I get you to do me a favor?
segments.cn: 对吧，我可以请你帮个忙吗？

segments.en: Also, I could say, will you do me a favor?
segments.cn: 另外，我可以说，你能帮我个忙吗？

segments.en: Will you do me a favor?
Right, so those are different ways of asking for a favor.
segments.cn: 对吧，这些都是请求帮忙的不同方式。

segments.en: Let's say you want to ask someone for a favor, right?
segments.cn: 假设你想请别人帮忙，对吧？

segments.en: But they're busy, right?
So you'll need some phrases to help you do this.
segments.cn: 所以你需要一些短语来帮助你做到这一点。

segments.en: Exactly, you need some phrases to interrupt somebody, right?
segments.cn: 正是如此，你需要一些短语来打断某人，对吧？

segments.en: So let's listen to some examples of what phrases you can use to begin to talk to someone.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听听你可以用来开始与某人交谈的短语示例。

segments.en: Yeah, to interrupt them.
Okay.
I hate to bother you, but... I hate to bother you, but...
segments.cn: 我不想打扰你，但... 我不想打扰你，但...

segments.en: I'm sorry to bother you, but...
I'm sorry to bother you, but...
I don't mean to bother you, but... I don't mean to bother you, but...
segments.cn: 我不是故意打扰你，但... 我不是故意打扰你，但...

segments.en: Okay, so those are really nice and polite ways of beginning to talk to someone.
segments.cn: 好的，这些都是开始与某人交谈的非常礼貌的方式。

segments.en: Exactly, they're really useful at the office.
segments.cn: 正是如此，它们在办公室非常有用。

segments.en: So maybe you want to talk to your boss, you knock on his door, kind of open it a little bit and say, I'm sorry to bother you, but I was wondering if you have time for a meeting today.
segments.cn: 所以也许你想和你的老板谈谈，你敲他的门，稍微打开一下，说，我很抱歉打扰你，但我想知道你今天有没有时间开会。

segments.en: Or you could say, I hate to bother you, but do you have time for a meeting today?
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，我不想打扰你，但你今天有时间开会吗？

segments.en: Exactly, so those are great ways of starting up a conversation and maybe setting it up to ask for a favor, right?
segments.cn: 正是如此，这些都是开始对话的好方法，也许为请求帮忙铺平道路，对吧？

segments.en: So we can combine them.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以把它们结合起来。

segments.en: I could say, I hate to bother you, but can you do me a favor?
segments.cn: 我可以说，我不想打扰你，但你能帮我个忙吗？

segments.en: Perfect, yeah, really useful.
So then you can ask someone for a favor.
segments.cn: 这样你就可以请别人帮忙。

segments.en: Yep.
Okay, great stuff.
So I guess we can listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 所以我想我们可以再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: Yeah, let's listen to our dialogue for the third time.
segments.cn: 是的，让我们第三次听我们的对话。

segments.en: And this time, I'm sure you'll understand it a lot better.
segments.cn: 这次，我相信你会更好地理解。

segments.en: Um, sorry to bother you.
My name is Rachel.
I'm new here.
Can I ask you for a favor?
Hi, Rachel.
Welcome on board.
I'm afraid I can't help you right now.
segments.cn: 我恐怕现在无法帮助你。

segments.en: I'm getting ready for a very important meeting.
segments.cn: 我正在准备一个非常重要的会议。

segments.en: Excuse me, but can I bother you for a second?
segments.cn: 对不起，但我可以打扰你一下吗？

segments.en: You know what?
I'd love to help you, but I'm about to meet an important client.
segments.cn: 我很想帮助你，但我马上要见一个重要客户。

segments.en: Do you want to ask Sean instead?
Can you sit right over there?
Sorry to interrupt you, Sean.
Could you do me a quick favor?
Actually, I'm working on a document that's due in a couple of minutes.
segments.cn: 其实，我正在处理一份几分钟后到期的文件。

segments.en: I really can't talk right now.
Sorry about that.
Geez, I just want to know where the bathroom is.
segments.cn: 天哪，我只是想知道洗手间在哪里。

segments.en: What's wrong with you people?
All right, so now you have all the vocabulary necessary the next time you need to ask someone for a favor.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在你们有了下次请求别人帮忙所需的所有词汇。

segments.en: Yes.
At the office, with your friends, with your family, anyone.
segments.cn: 在办公室，和朋友，和家人，任何人。

segments.en: Well, everyone, we are out of time for today.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，今天的时间到了。

segments.en: But remember to visit our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 但记得访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Exactly.
At our website, you'll find the script of the dialogue.
segments.cn: 在我们的网站上，你会找到对话的脚本。

segments.en: And also, you'll find intermediate lessons, upper intermediate, and even advanced.
segments.cn: 还有，你会找到中级课程、高级课程，甚至是高级课程。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
Our website is a great resource for learning.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是学习的好资源。

segments.en: Marco and I are always there to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我总是在那里回答你的问题。

segments.en: And we also have lots of helpful users who answer your questions.
segments.cn: 我们还有很多乐于助人的用户来回答你的问题。

segments.en: Exactly.
So don't miss out.
Come to our website at EnglishPod.com.
And we'll see you there.
Until next time.
Bye-bye.
Bye.
